body.p:
George W. Simpson of the County of Grant in the state aforesaid states on oath that he has been acquainted with James Webb, now of said county of Grant, since his child-hood, that he is now about twenty three years of age, that he lived in Grant -- at the Commencement of the war he was of secession sentiments & sympathized with the Rebellion --, and during the Kirby Smith raid
in Ky. said Webb went off with the rebel army, was a Lieut in the Rebel service, as he has told me himself -- that he remained with the rebels from the fall of 1862 until some five or six weeks ago --
Subscribed & sworn to by G. W. Simpson before me this 24 July 1865.
C. A. Preston Mayor C. C.
